The Senior Contract Specialist is responsible for administering Group Purchasing Org (GPO) and Integrated Delivery Network (IDN) contracts within various cross divisional systems, reviewing price discrepancies, and processing price activations relative to these contracts. Responsible for ensuring membership rosters are maintained and routinely updated. As the voice for strategic pricing and contracts analysis supporting the Healthcare Business Unit, you will interface with Sales, Sales Management, Operations, Marketing, Finance and Legal to apply business management principles and financial concepts that maximize the company's performance against sales and profit goals, while minimizing risk. Ideal Candidate: Ability to effectively interpret information to demonstrate the effects of business initiatives, regulation and industry trends for sales, management, and leadership teams. Uses industry experience to develop best practices related to GPOs. Enjoys compiling, organizing, and consolidating large volumes of data and reports. Innovative thinker with ability to drive change and effectiveness through automation and process excellence. Analytical problem solver with the ability to evaluate key business drivers and develop clear solution recommendations. Ability to plan, organize, and manage a variable workload and meet schedules with accurate results. Key Responsibilities: Subject matter expert on GPO contractual obligations and the impacts they have on various processes. Partners with Sales and Marketing team to assist in the management of contracts and pricing as it relates to GPO customers and contractual requirements. Assists with membership management and triages customer contract initiatives due to membership changes. In collaboration with Leadership, manages the RFP process for GPO customers. Oversees on-going contract maintenance for GPO addendum customers. Works with Business & Financial Analysts to develop pricing for GPO customers. Process LOC's (Letters of Commitment), GPO changes, and price applications as well as answer any questions relative to membership or GPO pricing eligibility. Be the subject matter expert and business process owner around GPO membership, IDN membership, contract loading, and tiered pricing eligibility. Collect and analyze data across various databases. Provide analysis of customer information to include sales as needed by our internal customers to evaluate LOC requests from external customers. Support contract audit request with documentation and pricing eligibility data to support the GPO. Maintain GPO membership rosters and implement a structured process for internally auditing all major GPO rosters and IDN rosters; routinely validate and update in the administration of GPO and IDN contracts to include maintaining pricing in ERP systems, documentation, and reporting. Continuously review internal processes and technology to identify improvement opportunities and develop implementable strategies targeted to improve effectiveness and efficiency. Build relationships with cross functional partners in Legal, Finance, Sales and Master Data Management teams. (Contracting, Customer Intelligence, etc.) Identify Client's customer number based on customer address demographics. Manage all GPO migrations/transitions based on policy and customer designation. Manages additions, deletions or modifications to contract business terms in accordance with company policy, legal requirements and stakeholder specifications. Requirements: 5+ years' experience in contract operations and demonstrated membership management, pricing strategy expertise and/or related areas. Experience in ERP (SAP) and reporting (Business Intelligence) systems Bachelor's degree in Business, Business Administration, Accounting, Finance, Economics, or other related field. (Preferred) Experience with healthcare industry suppliers, medical devices or technology industry and commitment, compliance, & administration functional area. (Preferred) Experience with, and/or certification in, contract lifecycle management and rebate & fee calculation tools and technologies and ERPs.
